review_blob: Dark Amber color with a slight white foam head. Aromas of pineapple and grapefruit. Initial taste of tingly hops. Palate of bubbly hops with great balance. Lingering aftertaste fades naturally, and in no ways premature..like a beautiful sunset!
Another great Victory beer. Light in color. Easily quaffable. Quite satisfying.
Cloudy orange appearance. Lacking in aroma perhaps with subtle hints of orange and lemon. Dances on your tongue with warming citrus and hop overtones. Finished nicely with s lingering bitterness.

Inviting golden color with frothy white head. Aroma of citrus.dances on your tongue, great mouth feel. Quite bitter on initial taste with pleasant lingering bitter, fruity finish. One of my favorite session IPAs.

Pours a sudsy, golden orange.  Aromas of citrus, especially grapefruit.   Nice white lacing on beer glass. Very chewy on initial taste and impressively balanced considering the strong hops presence. Intense tingling on tongue suggestive of great mouthful.  A highly enjoyable IPA.
beer_name: 21st Amendment Brew Free or Die IPA

review_blob: Pours a bit light in color.  Wonderfully complex citrusy, ripe fruit aroma.  Initial tangerine taste quickly followed by resiny, tingly hop wash.  Mouthfeel could be more intense.  Aftertaste lasts just right then fades almost entirely.
Decent color.  Malty nose.  Initial taste of sweet malts.  Hops are somewaht lacking and grassy in barely perceptible taste.  Not a terribly enjoyable brew.

Light golden color, but still darker than I remember for a Dortmunder.  Very bubbly on pour.  Nose of honey & sweet malts.  Inital taste of slightly stale biscuit.  Flavor is balanced but seems a bit watery. Slightly sweet aftertaste.  Overall, not bad.

Blond, straw color in appearance with perfect two fingerhead. Not much aroma, but perhaps my cold is to blame. Inital clean taste of chewy malts.  Nice mouthfeel.  Warming alcohol aftertase with nice balance.  Nothing offensive here.  Overall a solid pilsner.

Beautiful orange-copper pour.  Perfect frothy, white-laced head. Aroma of hemp, freshly cut grass and grapefruit.  Initial taste of grapefruit, orange and tree bark.  Fairly balanced palate. Warming alcohol aftertaste with a prodigious mouthfool of hops.  I love this stuff!

Poured somewhat flat with little to no carbonation.  Sweet caramel on the nose.  Initial taste of lemon, grass and caramel.  Finish is better with hops and spicy cinnamon overtones.  Overall, a bit of a disppointment.

Poured a slightly hazy orange copper color with an appropriate small head.  Nose is outstanding--dare I say perfect? Flavor is a tad sweet with resiny, chewy hops becoming apparent but never overpowering.  Nice mouthfeel with a light warming sensation. A superb double IPA with a truly fabulous, memorable nose.
A classic brown ale:  Sweet, fruity aroma;  good brown color.  Initial taste of fruity caramel.  Aftertaste of citrusy hops.  Mouthfeel is a tad watery, otherwise simply terrific.

Poured a cloudy, coppery amber. Small but heavy head.  Aroma of licorice, grass & lemon.  Initial taste of wood.  Powerful aftertaste of wet hops with warming alcohol overtones.  Not much in the way of caramel malts to detect & thats what makes this brew so wonderful!
beer_name: Rogue Nation Brutal India Pale Ale

review_blob: Awesome golden amber color.  Nose of orange, cherry tobacco & plastic.  Flavor of orange & cherry.  Not bad mouthfeel.  Extra long aftertaste reveals tobacco & sweet malts.  This is a tad unusua, but pleasant beer.

Poured deep gold & coppery with a strong, sustained head.  Nose of grapefruit and fresh cut grass.  Initial taste of wood, pine & grapefuit finishing with a alcohol heavy, tangy warming feel.  This beer is anything but subtle.  Frankly, Im surprised the IBUs & alcohol content arent higher.  I love it, nevertheless.
beer_name: Great Divide Fresh Hop Pale Ale

review_blob: Poured a hazy, light gold color with a rich creamy head.  Floral, grassy nose.  Initial taste reveals rich malts, followed by coffee, ending with a warming alcohol, hoppy tang.
Nice light straw appearance.  Nose of fresh cut grass.  Initial taste of malt.  Sweet for just a second then sweetness relaced with biscuity malts.  Fairly true to style but perhaps a tad watery.
A pretty gold on the pour.  Citrusy & floral on the nose.  Decent malt taste backwashed with a mouthful of hops.  Nevertheless, mouthfeel is too mild and beer seems weak & watery.

Poured a nice golden color.  Biscuit aroma.  TIngly initial taste primarily consisting of hops.  Nutty flavor (as advertised) apparent. Beer doesnt seem to be well balanced though.  Mouth feel initially is strong, which I enjoy, but palate reveals something is missing.

Poured well:  Nice creamy head.  Not particularly clear though. Is this stuff unfiltered?  Nose of citrus hops and metallic rust.  Tasted lemon peel, apricot and not much else. Nothing real offensive here, but nothing remarkable either.

What a terrific pale ale!  The golden color is a tad on the dark side.  Citrusy nose primarily consisting of lemon.  Initial taste is pine & sweet malt.  Great chewy mouthfeel with sensational balance.  Hops linger as the taste slowly fades.
beer_name: Great Lakes Burning River Pale Ale

review_blob: Appeared a bit light in color for a dunkel.  Strong aroma of banana & clove.  Fruity on initial taste.  Nice mouth feel.  An easily drinkable Dunkel Weiss.
This is a really, really good stout!  Dark, deep rich color.  Nose of chocolate, carmel and roasted barley.  Initial taste of carmel and coffee finishing with just enough hops to cut any sweetness.
Hop Head Heaven here in Homewood!  Tried on tap locally.  Gorgeous copper color, very hoppy nose.  Beautiful balanced taste finishing with a massive bitter, citrusy twang.  I need more!!

Tried this out of a bottle labeled "Morimoto Soba Ale."   Color is fairly light.  Aroma is floral-like. Initial taste of roasted nuts.  Clean, dry, hoppy finish.  Overall, a decent "ale light," certainly non-offensive and easy to drink.

Pours like SAE 30.  Price likely fluctuates with crude oil futures!  Not much head on the pour.  Very roasty on the nose.  Initial taste is roasted coffee followed by dark berries.  Aftertaste is fairly smooth as hops cut through mild fruitiness.

A little fruity on the nose.  Strong head due to high carbonation.  A bit cloudy through its bright golden color.  Initial taste is fruity with a strong, fizzy mouthfeel.  Aftertaste hints of banana, spice and very good balance.  The bottle says alcohol content is 8.2%;  suffice to say, its well hidden.

Looks like your typical bottom fermented brew, nice clean light golden color with a decent white head.  Aroma of flowers and malt.  Initial taste was slighty lemony with a strong undetectable flavor that I was unaccustomed too.  Not unpleasant, just funky.
Very pleasant stout.  Somewhat fruity on the nose.  Initial taste of chocolate and malts with a fairly strong presence of alcohol.  Aftertaste is suggestive of coffee and alcohol warmth.

Couldnt detect much aroma.  Certainly nothing offensive here.  Deep, dark inviting color.  Intial taste of chocolate, roasted nuts, perhaps a little coffee.  Wonderful lingering aftertaste of roasted malts and cocoa.
beer_name: Anderson Valley Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: Pours straw yellow.  Light citrus nose.  Not sweet, not hoppy, just perfectly balanced.
Sweet and somewhat grassy on the nose.  Poured a cloudy, golden color.  Terrific mouthfeel.  Tasted sweet initially but hops quickly neutralized things, leaving a pleasant, balanced aftertaste.
Couldnt pick up much aroma, but what a fantastic brew!  Great mouthfeel and balance.  Overtones of coffee & chocolate linger pleasantly after taking a sip.
Really improves as it warms up and becomes incredibly complex.  Just enough coffee and chocolate overtones to satisfy.  Perhaps a little sweet and medicinal, but otherwise near perfect.
An extremely smooth, enjoyable stout.  Very easy to drink due to nice balance.  Initial taste reveals more malt than anything else.  Aftertaste reveals coffee and hops.  A real pleasure to drink!

This was a slight disappointment for me.  Everything seemed in order except initial taste was lacking.  I expected more.  My feelings were subsequently confirmed as the finish was weak too.  Perhaps my tastebuds were tainted from the Jever I had immediately prior to the Tuppers...
Beautiful red color.  Small head despite high carbonation.  Aroma is sweet and fruity.  Initial taste of cherries.  Very classy and refreshing overall.

This was a bit of a disappointment for me.  The appearance was much too clear for an unfiltered beer.  Moreover, the flavors were just to bland.  I expected alot more banana and clove overtones.  Last the beer even tasted somewhat watery and lacked decent mouthfeel.  Maybe I just had a bad draft.  Regardless, I have no desire to try it again.

I tried this Pils last evening at the Penn Brewery and personally found it outstanding.  Its a shame they dont bottle this beer or even offer growlers to go...yet.  The malts had noticeable hints of honey that were perfectly balanced with the aromatic hops.  The aftertaste lingered pleasantly.  I need more!

Plain seltzer water tastes more interesting than this!  This "beer" is not offensive in any way; it simply has no real characteristics.  Its color slighly resembles a light chablis-dare I say urine!  There is carbonation, but enough is enough.  The pendulum has swung too far on this whole low-carb thing.

Excellent representation of classic Belgian wit style.  Wonderful nose, flavor is pleasant with floral and banana overtones.  Seems somewhat lacking in mouthfeel though.  Other than that, anout perfect!
Very enjoyable!  Tasted somewhat reminiscent of prunes or raisins but very roasty.  Carbonation is suberb.  Held a nice head the whole way down.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Been to a hair salon lately?  I think this beer was too.  The aroma reminds me of hair dye and perfume.  Unfortunately, it tastes like hair dye too.  Perhapo I had a bad bottle. Regardless, Ill leave this one for the stylists to enjoy.  Yuck!!
Balanced with strong alcohol overtones.  Surprisingly light in color and crystal clear. Fabulous head retention, a little fruity and chewy.

Nice head, fair color; strange, unfamiliar aroma.  Flavor is a blend of coffee and over-ripe fruit; fortunately, this fades to a malty aftertaste after 20 seconds or so. In sum, this beer is appropriately named: The "lost" sailor is no accident!
beer_name: Berkshire Lost Sailor India Pale Ale

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Appropriate copper color, great head retention, pleasant citrusy aroma, good mouth feel.  This IPA disppoints, however, due to its strong, lingering malt aftertaste.
Pours well, gorgeous straw color, odd aroma though.  Tastes good and the aftertaste is even better.

Golden straw-like, crisp and clear in appearance.  Holds a hearty off-white head.  Nice citrusy nose suggesting a perfect balance of malts and hops later confirmed by tasting.  Wonderful warm finish.  Stone Ruination, you've met your match!

Awesome artwork on the bottle greets the eye. Spicy on the nose.  Hints of pine and nutmeg dance nicely together upon first sip. Aftertaste is, accordingly, very "Christmasy."  A totally quality and appropriate beer for the Holidays!
